freenet.clients.http
Class Toadlet

java.lang.Object
  freenet.clients.http.Toadlet
Direct Known Subclasses:
BookmarkEditorToadlet, BrowserTestToadlet, ChatForumsToadlet, ConfigToadlet, ConnectionsToadlet, ConnectivityToadlet, DarknetAddRefToadlet, FirstTimeWizardToadlet, FProxyToadlet, InsertFreesiteToadlet, LocalFileInsertToadlet, N2NTMToadlet, PproxyToadlet, QueueToadlet, SecurityLevelsToadlet, SimpleHelpToadlet, StartupToadlet, StaticToadlet, StatisticsToadlet, SymlinkerToadlet, TranslationToadlet, UserAlertsToadlet, WelcomeToadlet
public abstract class Toadlet
extends Object

Replacement for servlets. Just an easy to use HTTP interface, which is compatible with continuations (eventually). You must extend this class and provide the abstract methods. Apologies but we can't do it as an interface and still have continuation compatibility; we can only suspend in a member function at this level in most implementations. When we eventually implement continuations, these will require very little thread overhead: We can suspend while running a freenet request, and only grab a thread when we are either doing I/O or doing computation in the derived class. We can suspend while doing I/O too; on systems with NIO, we use that, on systems without it, we just run the fetch on another (or this) thread. With no need to change any APIs, and no danger of exploding memory use (unlike the traditional NIO servlets approach). Obviously this assumes continuations, and that we can suspend in a method on Toadlet ... which might be possible. FIXME Investigate servlet 3.0, which support continuations.

showAsToadlet

public Toadlet showAsToadlet()
So an invisible toadlet can pretend to be a visible one for the sake of the menu.

findSupportedMethods

public final String findSupportedMethods()
Which methods are supported by this Toadlet. Should return a string containing the methods supported, separated by commas For example: "GET, PUT" (in which case both 'handleMethodGET()' and 'handleMethodPUT()' must be implemented). IMPORTANT: This will discover inherited methods because of getMethod() below. If you do not want to expose a method implemented by a parent class, then *OVERRIDE THIS METHOD*.

sendErrorPage

protected void sendErrorPage(ToadletContext ctx,
                             String desc,
                             String message,
                             Throwable t)
                      throws ToadletContextClosedException,
                             IOException
Send an error page from an exception.

Parameters:
ctx - The context object for this request.
desc - The title of the error page
message - The message to be sent to the user. The stack trace will follow.
t - The Throwable which caused the error.
Throws:
IOException - If there is an error writing the reply.
ToadletContextClosedException - If the context has already been closed.

getClientImpl

protected HighLevelSimpleClient getClientImpl()
Get the client impl. DO NOT call the blocking methods on it!! Just use it for configuration etc.
